title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is in Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Transactions" will display a secondary and tertiary dropdown.
AND "Assignments" should be an option under the secondary dropdown. 
AND "Assign as 7th Coach" should be an option in the third level dropdown when "Assignments" is selected.
AND Selecting "Assign as 7th Coach" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
Or If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a user I want to be able to delete an Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee in Preliminary or Rejected states
custom_expected:
THEN user will see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode.
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
Title: Warning
Body: Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
Hint: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
Buttons: Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
AND If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating an Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user Initials an Assign as 7th Coach transaction for a 7th coach
AND Employee's Current Org is different from logged in club user's Org
custom_steps: WHEN user selects Assign as 7th Coach transaction on the Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should display a blocking message "You do not have permission to create a transaction for an employee that belongs to another Organization. If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact the BOC."
AND clicking "Back" will return the user to the entry point
Or If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.

title: As a user I want to Submit an Assign as 7th Coach to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
AND transaction is in preliminary or rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Submit to BOC" button (Blue for Club users and grey for the BOC)
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
AND After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
AND An approvals item will be generated for the BOC. 
AND The transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =AS7CO Description = Assign as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a BOC user I want to approve an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC, or Rejected status
AND blue "Approve" button is available
custom_steps: WHEN the BOC user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND If applicable, the BOC approvals item is removed.
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND Update Player's Player History: Code =AS7CO Description = Assign as 7th Coach , From Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a BOC user I want to reject an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND grey "Reject" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks "Reject"
custom_expected:
THEN BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
AND The item is removed from the player's history. 
AND The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to suppress an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction has been approved or Reversed for a player
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user is on Assign as 7th Coach transaction in view or Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. Reverse is handled in a previous story so this story will only deal with the suppression. 
AND When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
AND Suppressing a transaction will also remove any notifications that were generated for the transaction prior to suppression.
AND A blue notification should be thrown saying "The transaction has been successfully suppressed"

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when an Assign as 7th Coach is rejected, approved or reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach tx exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a club
custom_steps: WHEN Assign as 7th Coach tx reaches a rejected, approved or reversed status
custom_expected:
THEN a notification will appear on the notification clipboard 
AND Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
Or Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected.
Or Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
AND "Description" will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
AND Player's name will be a hyperlink.
AND Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN user with edit permission logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state.
AND Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND in Preliminary, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
OR In states other than Preliminary, edit only gives clubs access to attach new files. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and AND "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.

See Wireframe: 
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=voluntary_designation

title: As a BOC Approver I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to approve a transaction with an assignment date after the current date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver logs in
AND Assignment date on the Assign as 7th Coach transaction is set after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Approve
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the current date is after the assignment date entered on the transaction. If yes, display an error. See Messages #9.
See Error Message #9:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is in Employee Profile
AND Employee has an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on Transaction on employee's History (or Advanced Search)
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window.
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: Assign as 7th Coach - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission
BOC users with a Editor permission can:
  -Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
  -Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
  -Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
  -Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
  However, there are exceptions:
       1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
       2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
  -Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
       1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
       2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
       3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: Assign as 7th Coach - Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club viewer account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Viewer permission
-BOC users with a Viewer permission can*:
  -- Can view and Print all employee transactions in all states but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
  --Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

-Club users with a Viewer permission can*:
  --Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
 -Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2.  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is 
         currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: Remove as 7th Coach - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission
BOC users with a Editor permission can*:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
 - Can create, delete, edit, and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
 - Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
- Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
However, there are exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state

- Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:

Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Assign/Reassign transaction for a person

AND Selecting "Assign/Reassign Employee" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Assign/Reassign Employee transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens a new Assign/Reassign Employee transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Title: Warning
Body: Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
Hint: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
Buttons: Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a user I want to Submit an Assign/Reassign Employee to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
AND Employee has an existing Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
AND transaction is in Preliminary or Rejected status
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks "Submit" button (Blue for club users and grey for the BOC)
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking Submit will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
AND If the transaction is NOT for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction will automatically move to "Approved", after passing all On Approve rules. All on approve updates are run per story #151142704.
OR If the transaction IS for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
AND After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
AND An approvals item will be generated for the BOC if the transaction has been moved to Submitted to BOC. 
AND If the transaction is for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =ASGEE Description = Assign/Reassign Employee to Roster as {Position}  , From Org/Club fields. Otherwise, no entry is added.

AND blue "Approve" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC approver clicks on "Approve"
custom_expected:
THAN Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND If applicable, the BOC approvals item is removed.
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND If applicable, update Player's Player History: Code =ASGEE Description = Assign/Reassign Employee as {Position} , From Org/Club fields in black font. 
AND All other "Approval" updates per the provided business rules.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to supress an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction

custom_expected:

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Remove Employee from Org transaction for an employee

AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
OR If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_employee_from_org

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=120636039
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC approver
AND an Assign/Reassign Employee tx has been submitted to BOC for approval
custom_steps: WHEN BOC approver Approves the Assign/Reassign tx
custom_expected:
THEN system should assign the employee's roster status based on the status of the contract
AND if the employee has a current Approved or Submit Signed UEC, then the roster status should be set to "Active"
BUT if the employee does not have a current Approved or Submit Signed UEC, then the roster status should be set to "Active, Not Under Contract"

title: As a user I want changing the employee's position to auto-create an assign/reassign transaction for the employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged with edit employee contract permissions 
AND user is viewing a employee contract in Approved or Submit Signed state
custom_steps: When user clicks "Change Position"
custom_expected:
THEN system will enable the position fields for editing. 
AND On Save, if the Change Position action has been taken, the system should check if the employee's current position differs from the new position on the UEC.
AND If yes, then an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction is auto-created and submitted for the employee for the position indicated on the UEC. 
AND All stateflow changes and submission/approval updates should follow the Assign/Reassign rules as though it were created manually.

Wireframe (scroll down and to the right):
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=info_and_general_layout

See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=120636039

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List
Wireframe: 
http://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=place_on_temporary_inactive_list
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with Create New Permissions for Temp Inactive list tx
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to an Employee Profile
AND selects Create New
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" should be an option in the top-level dropdown
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Employee Transactions
AND "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" should be an option in the third level dropdown
AND selecting "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" from the Create New should check to see if there is an existing Preliminary, Submitted to BOC or Rejected MN Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date
AND if a preliminary or rejected transaction already exists, the system should load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction
AND if a submitted transaction already exists, the system should load the existing transaction in View Mode
BUT if no preliminary, submitted or rejected transaction created within 10 days of the current date exists, the system should load a new Preliminary transaction
AND transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user with edit permissions for the transaction is logged in
AND transaction is in Preliminary or Rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the form in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Delete" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Delete" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system
AND warning should be as follows:
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND if they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction and a blue notification should be thrown
BUT if they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken

title: As a user I want to view an existing Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List
Wireframe: 
http://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=place_on_temporary_inactive_list
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with view permissions for Temp Inactive List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to open a Temp Inactive list tx from Employee's history or adv search
custom_expected:
THEN clicking on the transaction in an employee's History or Advanced Search should open the transaction in the same window
AND the layout of the transaction should match the View mode of the provided wireframe
AND fields should match the provided data discovery
AND whenever the form is in view mode, the user should see a "Close" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Close" should return the user to their entry point into the transaction
AND the field Current Status should display in red if the transaction is in a preliminary state, green if pending and black for all other states(global AC)

title: As a BOC user I want approving an Employee's Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction to create an entry in the daily transaction bulletin if applicable
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with daily transaction bulletin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN a  "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List" is approved for a MJ Roster employee
custom_expected:
THEN transaction should appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as  "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List"
AND when a  "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List" transaction is reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed
BUT if it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as " "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List - Reversed" 
AND when a  "Placed on Temporarily Inactive List" is suppressed, if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed

title: As a user I want to submit a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with create/submit permissions for Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new preliminary or rejected Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN a Submit to BOC button is available to Club users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is blue. 
AND Submit button is available for BOC users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is grey.
AND clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND after the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND system reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification.  
AND once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system sets the employee's pending Status to "Temporarily Inactive".
AND when a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item will be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget. 
AND If a file is attached to the transaction, that is displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget. 
AND If Comments are populated on the transaction, they display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget.
AND employee name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the employee name will open the profile (defaults to History tab) in the same window/tab. 
AND Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab.
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in employee's History in green font. Code = EETMPIN, Description = Place on Temporarily Inactive List, From Org.

See Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Place+on+Temporarily+Inactive+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for an employee at the MJ Level

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

AND user is attempting to create a "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" for an Employee
AND selected Employee is at the MJ level
custom_steps: WHEN user Selects "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" on the Employee Transactions create new menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should check to see if the Employee's current position level is Major League
AND if it is, system should display error #17 "Only a BOC user is authorized to use the selected transaction on this employee"
AND clicking "Back" should return the user to the point of entry

title: As a BOC user I want to approve or reject a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary or Submitted
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see an "Approve" button in blue 
AND Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.  
AND Update Player's Player History: Code = EETMPIN , Description = Place on Temporarily Inactive List , From Org/Club fields to be in black font. 
AND Update employee's Status to be Temporarily Inactive. 
OR BOC Approves see  "Reject" button when Temporarily Inactive List tx is in Submitted states 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories). 
AND Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND Successful reject notification is displayed. See Messages #15.
AND If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
AND Remove pending history entry.

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when my Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction is approved, rejected, or reversed
custom_preconds:
See Clipboard Rules (#1, #2, #3): 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Clipboard
See Wireframe: 
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=clipboard_-_notifications
GIVEN a club user is logged in 
AND a "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" transaction has been initiated for an Employee from user's club
custom_steps: WHEN "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" transaction is Approved, Rejected, or Reversed
custom_expected:
THEN initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved
AND initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected
AND initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed
AND "Description" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab 
AND player's name should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary or Rejected state, Club users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
AND BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give Clubs access to attach new files, but they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They should also be able to update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND a Save button should be available anytime the form is in edit mode
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Cancel" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT if they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action will be taken

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for an employee that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:

custom_steps: WHEN user Selects "Place on Temporarily Inactive List" on the Employee Transactions create new menu
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the employee's Current Org is set to the Org of the initiating user. 
AND If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction.
AND If the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the employee, then display message #1.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the employee I am creating a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for has a pending or approved transaction after the entered assignment date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for Place on Temporarily Inactive List Transactions
AND user is attempting to submit or approve a Place on Temporarily Inactive List Transactions 
AND Employee the tx is being created for has a pending or approved transaction dated after the entered assignment date of Place on Temporarily tx
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" (All places OnSubmit rules fired)
custom_expected: THEN system will check if the Assignment date is before the latest approved or pending (Pending to Club, Submitted to BOC) transaction date for the employee. If it is, an error will display. Messages #3.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, reverse and suppress or suppress a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse/Suppress Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Place+on+Temporarily+Inactive+List
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with approver permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Reverse" button in grey
AND clicking "Reverse" should run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. (On Submit rules should not be run)
AND successful reverse notification should be displayed. See Messages #16
AND the transaction status should be updated to "Reversed"
AND system should display reversed transaction in player history with "Voided" in front of the transaction description. Example:"Voided: Major/Minor Outright"
AND system should set the employee's Status, Club and Org to their values from prior to the transaction approval
AND users that have permission to suppress the form should see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode
AND clicking "Reverse and Suppress" should first reverse, and then suppress the transaction
AND clicking "Suppress" should suppress the transaction
AND when a transaction is suppressed it should be hidden from the employee's History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI
AND clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", should check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction
AND if the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the employee, then the user should receive an error message
**Message** "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND user will ONLY have the back option
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction

title: Place on Temporarily Inactive List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Club Viewer permissions for Temporarily Inactive list tx
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all Temp InactiveList transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too
BUT user should not be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions 
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
And user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. **Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org**
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive list tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too
BUT user should not be able to view or print Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. **Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org**
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should NOT be able to create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: Place on Temporarily Inactive List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Place on Temporarily Inactive List Admin Permissions
OR a club user is logged in with Employee Place on Temporarily Inactive List Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: When user attempts to do anything with a Temporarily Inactive Transactions
custom_expected:
THEN user with Viewer permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

OR User with Admin permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
BUT Can NOT create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: As a BOC user I want to approve a Place on Ineligible List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Ineligible List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see an "Approve" button in blue 
AND Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved. 
AND Update Employee's History: Code =  INELG , Description = Place on Ineligible List , From Org/Club field to be in black font. 
AND Update player's Employee Status to be "Ineligible".

See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/8.+Place+on+Ineligible+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Ineligible+List

title: As a BOC user I want approving an Employee's Place on Ineligible List transaction to create an entry in the daily transaction bulletin if applicable
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with daily transaction bulletin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN a Place on Ineligible List is approved for a MJ Roster employee
custom_expected:
THEN transaction should appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Ineligible List"
AND when a Place on Ineligible List transaction is reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed
BUT if it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Ineligible List - Reversed" 
AND when a Place on Ineligible List is suppressed, if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed

title: Place on Ineligible List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions  - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with Club Viewer permissions for Place on Ineligible List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Place on Ineligible List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
BUT user should not be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions 
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
And user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: Place on Ineligible List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions - Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in with viewer permissions for a Place on Ineligible List Transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Place on Ineligible List Transaction
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too
BUT user should not be able to view or print Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should not be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND user should not be able to see Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should NOT be able to create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only employee transactions for employees.

title: Place on Ineligible List Permissions - BOC - Employee Transactions - Basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Transactions Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with a Place on Ineligible List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user will be able to view and Print all employee transactions in all states for employees but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
And use will be able to view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Place on Ineligible List Permissions - BOC - Employee Transactions-Admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transactions Admin Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to do anything with Place on Ineligible List Transaction
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and Print all employee league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
AND user should be able to view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.
AND user should be able to create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Employee transactions for Employees (or players where applicable). 
and user should be able to  Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions and see associated Flags.

Currently Employee transactions do NOT have a print button

title: As a BOC Approver I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to approve a Place on Deceased List transaction with an assignment date after the current date
custom_preconds:
Business Rule #7.08: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
Error Message #9: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC approver
AND user is attempting to approve a Place on Deceased List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Approve" on the tx
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the assignment date entered on the transaction is after the current date
AND if yes, system should show Messages #9: "This transaction cannot be approved unless the placement date is on or before the current date."
AND only "Back" button should be available
AND Clicking "Back" should return user to the point of entry

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to submit a Place on Deceased List transaction for a player that has a prior pending transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user logs in with with Employee transaction permission
AND an employee has any existing Pending transactions prior to the entered assignment date on the new Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Approve on new Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN all places OnSubmit rules are fired 
AND system will check if the employee has any pending transactions with an assignment date prior to this transaction's assignment date.  If yes, display message #19.

See Business Rule #7.09: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List

See Error Message #19: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to submit a Place on Deceased List transaction for an Employee that has a prior pending transaction
custom_preconds:
Business Rule #7.09: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
Error Message #19: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with edit/submit permissions for Deceased List tx
AND user is attempting to submit a Place on Deceased list tx for an Employee
AND the chosen Employee already has a pending tx with an earlier date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the transaction being approved has a transaction date on or after other pending transactions for the player
AND if yes - an error (Messages #19) Should display stating: "This transaction cannot be approved while a previously submitted transaction is pending."
AND only "Back" button should be available
AND clicking "Back" should return the user to the point of entry

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when my Place on Deceased List transaction is approved, rejected or reversed
custom_preconds:
Clipboard Rules (#2, #3, #4): 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Clipboard
GIVEN a user is logged in as a club admin user
AND a Place on Deceased list tx has been submitted for an Employee from logged in user's org
custom_steps:
WHEN the Deceased List tx is Approved, Rejected, or Reversed
AND user is currently viewing the clipboard for their org
custom_expected:
THEN initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved
AND initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed
BUT if the transaction is also Suppressed, club should NOT receive a notification 
AND initiating Club (or the Club that the employee belongs to) should receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected
AND "Description" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab
AND Employee's name should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the employee's name hyperlink of any of these notifications should open the employee's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the History tab

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the employee I am creating a Place on Deceased List transaction for has an approved transaction after the entered assignment date
custom_preconds:
Business Rule #7.06: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
Error Message #3: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for Deceased List tx
AND user is attempting to submit or approve a Place on Deceased List tx
AND Employee that tx is being created for has an approved transaction dated after the assignment date of the Deceased List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the Assignment date is before the latest approved transaction date for the player
AND if the above condition is met on Clicking submit system should display Messages #3 as follows:
 "A transaction cannot **be scheduled** before the date of the player's latest approved or pending transaction, on <TX Date>."
AND "Ignore and Continue" button should be available (only for BOC and only on submit)
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" should continue with transaction submission
AND "Back" button should be available 
AND clicking back should return user to point of entry
BUT if the above condition is met on clicking Approve, system should display messages #3 as follows:
"A transaction cannot **occur** before the date of the player's latest approved or pending transaction, on <TX Date>."
AND "Back" button should be available 
AND clicking back should return user to point of entry

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the person I'm attempting to create a Deceased List transaction for is not a current employee
custom_preconds:
Business Rule #8.01, 8.05: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
Error Message #12: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with edit/create permissions for Deceased List tx
AND user is viewing the profile that is NOT a current Employee with an "Active" or "Active (Not Under Contract)" status
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Place on Deceased List" from the Employee Transaction Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the person is a current Employee with an "Active" or "Active (Not Under Contract)" status
AND if not, system should display Error #12: "This person is not an Active Employee."
AND only a "Back" button should be available
AND clicking "Back" should return user to the point of entry

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with edit permissions for Deceased List tx
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Place on Deceased List tx in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode
AND a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary state, the BOC users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
BUT club should not be able to edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction
AND BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. (They should also be able update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields)
BUT they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND a Save button should be available anytime the form is in edit mode
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Cancel" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT if they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action should be taken

title: As a user I want to submit a Place on Deceased List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
Submission Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with create/submit permissions for Place on Deceased list tx
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new preliminary or rejected Place on Deceased list tx in view or edit mode from create new
custom_expected:
THEN a Submit to BOC button should be available to Club users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button should be blue
AND Submit button should be available for BOC users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button should be grey
AND clicking Submit should run a required field and format check according to the data discovery
AND if any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user should receive an error message
AND clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other test cases - this test case assumes they all pass)
AND after the rules have passed, the system should update the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND system should reload the transaction in view mode, and display a successful submit blue notificationd
AND once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system should set the player's pending Status to "Deceased".
AND when a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item should be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget
AND if a file is attached to the transaction, that should be displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget
AND if Comments are populated on the transaction, they should display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget
AND player name should be a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. 
AND clicking on the player name should open the Player Profile (should default to Player History tab) in the same window/tab 
AND "Type" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction should open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system should create an entry in Player's Player History in green font. Code = DEAD (Not displayed on the front end), Description = Place on Deceased List, From Org.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, reverse and suppress or suppress a Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
Reverse/Suppress Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC approver
AND a Place on Deceased List tx has been approved for an Employee
custom_steps: WHEN BOC approver opens the Approved Place on Deceased List tx
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Reverse" button in grey (in view or edit mode)
AND clicking "Reverse" should run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules should not be run
AND a successful reverse notification should be displayed
AND the transaction status should be updated to "Reversed"
AND reversed transaction should display in player history with "Voided" in front of the transaction description. Example:"Voided: Place on Deceased List"
AND system should set the employee's Status, Club and Org to their values from prior to the transaction approval
AND users that have permission to suppress the form should see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode
AND clicking "Reverse and Suppress" should first reverse, and then suppress the transaction
AND clicking "Suppress" should suppress the transaction
AND when a transaction is suppressed it should be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI
AND clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", should check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction
AND if the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the player, then the user should receive an error message
**Message** "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND user should ONLY have the back option
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction

title: As a BOC user I want to approve a Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Ineligible List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers will see an "Approve" button in blue 
AND Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved. 
AND Update History: Code = DEAD (not displayed on front end) , Description = Place on Deceased List , From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields to be in black font. 
AND Update employee's to be "Deceased". Do NOT display this roster status. On front end roster status should appear blank. 
AND Status should not appear on profile or in advanced search. 
AND Update logo displayed on employee profile to standard MLB logo to signify they are no longer associated with a team.
AND Do NOT Add transaction to the Daily Transaction Bulletin.

See Approval Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/7.+Place+on+Deceased+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in with edit Employee Transaction permission
AND Place on Deceased List transaction already exist
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing Place on Deceased List transaction in Preliminary and Rejected states
custom_expected:
THEN user will see a "Delete" button on the form in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
AND Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? ("Form" to be replaced with transaction type)
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction and a blue notification should be thrown.
OR If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Place on Deceased List transaction for an Employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user logs in with Employee Transaction permission
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown (already built)
AND "Inactive List" should be an option under Employee Transactions.
AND "Place on Deceased List" should be an option in the third level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Place on Deceased List" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary Place on Deceased List transaction for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary transaction already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
Or If no preliminary transaction created within 10 days of the current date exists, the system will load a new Preliminary transaction.
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List

See Wireframe: 
http://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=place_on_deceased_list

title: As a user I want to view an existing Place on Deceased List transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in with Employee Transaction permission
AND Place on Deceased List transaction already exist
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking on the transaction in an employee's History or Advanced Search
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window. 
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND  Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey. 
AND  Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction. 

Global AC:
* The field Current Status will display in red if the transaction is in a preliminary state, green if pending and black for all other states.

See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Deceased+List

See Wireframe: 
http://r6vcv1.axshare.com/#p=place_on_deceased_list

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a Place on Deceased List transaction for an employee at the MJ Level
custom_preconds:

AND clicking "Back" should return the user to the point of entry

title: Place on Deceased List Permissions - Club - Employee Transactions
custom_preconds:
GIVE a club user is logged in with Employee Place on Deceased List Admin Permissions 
OR a club user is logged in with Employee Place on the Decease List Viewer Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN club user attempts to do anything with Place on Deceased List transactions
custom_expected:
THEN club with Viewer permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

OR club with admin permissions can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
